results.description: Wigan Warriors sign forward Kai Pearce-Paul from relegated London Broncos on a four-year contract.
results.shortTitle: Wigan sign Broncos' Pearce-Paul
results.title: Kai Pearce-Paul: Wigan Warriors sign London Broncos academy forward

results.description: Scrum-half Jordan Williams signs a contract with London Broncos, leaving capital neighbours London Skolars.
results.shortTitle: Williams re-signs for London Broncos
results.title: Jordan Williams: London Broncos signs scrum-half from Skolars

results.description: Salford Red Devils sign utility back Elliot Kear, winger Rhys Williams and forward Luke Yates from London Broncos.
results.shortTitle: Salford sign London Broncos trio
results.title: Salford Red Devils: Elliot Kear, Rhys Williams & Luke Yates join from London Broncos

results.description: Hull KR make London Broncos back-rower Matty Gee their seventh signing for the 2020 Super League season.
results.shortTitle: Gee leaves Broncos to join Hull KR
results.title: Matty Gee: Hull KR sign back-rower from London Broncos on one-year deal

results.description: Wakefield Trinity sign Scotland international full-back Alex Walker from relegated London Broncos on a two-year deal.
results.shortTitle: Wakefield sign Broncos full-back Walker
results.title: Alex Walker: Wakefield Trinity sign London Broncos full-back

results.description: London Broncos sign Widnes Vikings full-back Olly Ashall-Bott on a two-year deal.
results.shortTitle: Broncos sign Ashall-Bott from Widnes
results.title: Olly Ashall-Bott: London Broncos sign Widnes Vikings full-back

results.description: London Broncos' James Cunningham is cleared of racial abuse after a tribunal rules there was "not enough evidence to prove guilt".
results.shortTitle: Cunningham not guilty of racial abuse
results.title: James Cunningham: London Broncos hooker cleared of racial abuse

results.description: London Broncos head coach Danny Ward signs a new two-year deal with the club until the end of the 2021 season.
results.shortTitle: Broncos boss Ward signs new contract
results.title: Danny Ward: London Broncos head coach signs new two-year deal

results.description: London Broncos hooker James Cunningham could face a ban of at least eight games after being charged over a racial abuse allegation.
results.shortTitle: Cunningham faces racial abuse charge
results.title: Super League: London Broncos' James Cunningham faces racial abuse charge

results.description: London Broncos are relegated to the Championship after just one season back in Super League following defeat at Wakefield.
results.shortTitle: Wakefield win to relegate London Broncos
results.title: Super League: Wakefield Trinity win 19-10 to relegate London Broncos

thumbnail.altText: Dejected Broncos are relegated just 12 months on from being promoted back to Super League

results.description: A social media blackout, "crazy confidence" and fear of "destruction" are things Super League's relegation-threatened sides are dealing with this week.
results.shortTitle: Super League relegation goes to final day
results.title: Super League: London, Hull KR, Huddersfield and Wakefield prepared for relegation fight

thumbnail.altText: Split image of relegation-threatened Super League side

results.description: Four Super League clubs face a perilously terrifying Friday 13th, as relegation will haunt one of them in the final round.
results.shortTitle: Friday 13th fright night for Super League's four in danger
results.title: Super League: Wakefield, Huddersfield, London & Hull KR battle against relegation

thumbnail.altText: Tony Smith, Simon Woolford, Danny Ward and Chris Chester

results.description: London's Super League relegation showdown at Wakefield on Friday will be worth more than £1m to the winner, says Broncos owner David Hughes.
results.shortTitle: 'Bigger than the Million Pound Game'
results.title: Super League: London Broncos v Wakefield Trinity worth more than Million Pound Game

results.description: London Broncos lose at Wakefield and are relegated from Super League - relive the action from Friday's five games.
results.shortTitle: London relegated from Super League - the action as it happened
results.title: Super League live: London Broncos relegated - the action as it happened

results.description: Jay Pitts scores a late try to earn victory for London at Hull KR and take the Super League relegation scrap to the final day.
results.shortTitle: Broncos beat Hull KR to extend relegation scrap
results.title: Super League: London Broncos beat Hull KR to take relegation battle to final day

thumbnail.altText: Jay Pitts has scored tries in both London Broncos' visits to Craven Park this season

results.description: Friday's action in the Super League - listen to BBC Radio commentary.
results.shortTitle: Listen: Friday's Super League commentaries
results.title: Listen to live Super League commentaries

results.description: Head coach Danny Ward wants to remain at London Broncos, regardless of which division the club is playing in next season.
results.shortTitle: Ward wants extended London Broncos stay
results.title: Danny Ward: London Broncos head coach wants to stay despite potential relegation

results.description: Leeds Rhinos all but secure their Super League safety with a 36-10 win at London Broncos, who slip closer to relegation.
results.shortTitle: Leeds thump struggling Broncos
results.title: London Broncos 10-36 Leeds Rhinos: Broncos on brink but Leeds look safe

results.description: Sunday's action in Super League & the Championship - listen to BBC Radio commentary.
results.shortTitle: Listen: Sunday's Super League & Championship action
results.title: Listen to live Super League & Championship commentaries

results.description: Super League bottom club London Broncos further spice up the relegation battle by damaging Catalans Dragons' top-five bid.
results.shortTitle: Broncos upset Catalans in Perpignan
results.title: Super League: Bottom club London Broncos win 17-4 to upset Catalans

thumbnail.altText: Only four players have scored more points in Super League this season than Kieran Dixon, who ended with a 10-point individual haul
